Fletcher v. Fletcher, 406 Mass. 112 (198.relevant_excerpt: We reject the defendant’s argument that G. L. c. 11 IB, § 8, is unconstitutional in authorizing police officers to take into protective custody and search “incapacitated” persons who are “likely to suffer or cause physical harm or damage property” (G. L. c. 11 IB, § 3). He argues that § 8 violates the prohibition against unreasonable searches and seizures of the Massachusetts (art. 14), and United States Constitutions (Fourth and Fourteenth Amendments).

McKenna v. McKenna, 423 Mass. 621 (1996).relevant_excerpt: “The Commissioner of Revenue (commissioner) denied Paul R. Dupee, Jr., and Lizbeth Schiff’s application for abatement of individual nonresident income tax for 1986 on their capital gain… General Laws c. 62, § 5A (a), sets forth the statutory scheme for income taxation of nonresidents of Massachusetts. At issue in this case is the proper construction of the portion we have emphasized above.”

Vickers v. Vickers, 58 Mass. App. Ct. 58.relevant_excerpt: "In this G.
